page.title: 01LERRYN AND COUCH'S MILL
page.content: This is a sparsely populated, rural area of outstanding natural beauty and is contained within the three parish boundaries of{St.Winnow, {Boconnoc and Lanreath. Most of the population live in the small village of{Lerryn}and the hamlet of{Couch's Mill,}the rest live on the farms and cottages scattered around the area. The main features of the area are the{Lerryn river}which is tidal as far as Lerryn Bridge,{Boconnoc Estate and{Ethy House. The resident population consists of mainly retired people and those involved with farming. During the summer the number of visitors to the area, greatly increases the population.
